about.about_text: Samply is developed by Yury Shevchenko and conceptualized by him and Ulf-Dietrich Reips, with the help of many great collaborators. Yury is a postdoc in the iScience group at the University of Konstanz in Germany.
about.citation: Shevchenko, Y., Kuhlmann, T., & Reips, U. D. (2021). Samply: A user-friendly smartphone app and web-based means of scheduling and sending mobile notifications for experience-sampling research. Behavior Research Methods, 1-21.
about.contact_github: Wish to contribute? Welcome to our Github.
about.feature_1: Samply is free, there is no hidden costs (thanks to the generous support of the iScience group)
about.feature_2: Native mobile application for participants available in Google Play or App Store.
about.feature_3: Different types of notifications schedule (one-time, repeat, user-dependent, randomized).
about.feature_4: Customization of messages and URL links that you send to participants.
about.feature_5: Recording participants' responses to your notifications.
about.for_participants: If you are a participant, you are probably looking for a mobile application Samply Research. You can find in App Store or Google Play.
about.intro2: With Samply you can create and plan notifications for participants of your studies. You can edit content of notifications and send links to your survey or online tests. As a participant, you have to use an Android mobile phone to receive notifications.
about.part_1_text: For many reasons: financial reward, interest in the topic or just curiosity.
about.part_2_text: Sign up with a participant code, email or social network account
about.part_3_text: Receive notifications using your mobile phone
about.res_2_text: HTTPS, user authentication system, personal invitations.
about.test_drive: Are you a researcher and want to use Samply in your studies? Here is an overview of how Samply works, our publication in Behavior Research Methods, and step-by-step tutorial in English or German.
about.welcome_text: Samply supports experience sampling, ambulatory assessment and diary studies. We want to make sending notifications to participants an easy and comfortable task for researchers. The main idea is that you as a researcher are free to use any tool to create an online survey or an experiment.  Samply sends mobile notifications through the Samply mobile application, so when participants of your study click on the notification, they open your online study in a mobile web-browser.

account.deleteProjectHere: Here you can remove your project by clicking on the red X on the project card.
account.deleteSureQuestion: If you delete your account, all of your account and data will be deleted and can not be recovered. Are you sure you want to delete?
account.enterDelete: Please enter 'delete' to delete your account.
account.name: Name
account.no_studies: You are not currently participating in any study. Select the study from the list of studies.
account.participate_in_studies: You participate in the following studies
account.payableConfirmEmail: First confirm your email address to register a payable account
account.payableCreateAccount: You can create a payable account in order to receive payments for participating in studies. Payments and invoicing are managed by our partner Stripe.
account.removeProjectsFirst: Please remove all your projects first to delete your own account.
account.title: Edit account

api.apiCode: JavaScript code to use Samply API to send a notification
api.apiCommentFunction: // function to send the POST request to activate the notification
api.apiExplained_1: If you specify the group ID and the participant ID, the notification will be sent to all members of this group except the participant. If you specify the group ID but omit the participant ID, the notification will be sent to all members of this group. If you omit the group ID but specify the participant ID, the notification will be sent to the specific participant. If you omit the group ID and the participant ID, the notification will be sent to all participants in the study.
api.apiExplained_2: Parameters title, message, and url define the content of the notification that will be displayed in the notification.

docs.data_1: There are two ways to monitor participation: via the list of participants (‚ÄúParticipants‚Äù menu) and the history of notifications sent (‚ÄúHistory‚Äù menu).
docs.data_history_1: The ‚ÄúHistory‚Äù menu displays the time points for the following events of each notification:
docs.data_history_2_1: When the notification was sent from the server.
docs.data_history_2_2: When the user opened the online study by tapping on the notification.
docs.data_history_2_3: When the user opened the notification within the mobile application.
docs.data_history_2_4: When the user archived the notification message within the mobile application.
docs.data_history_3: The title, message, and study URL for each notification are shown. If the user dismisses a notification, no event is triggered or recorded. Clicking on the user ID reveals the notification events filtered for that user. To further inspect and analyze their interactions with notifications, the history of all the participant‚Äôs events can be downloaded in the CSV format.
docs.data_participants_1: The list of participants is displayed in the order of registration to the study. The "Status" column indicates whether a participant is receiving notifications or not. You can toggle the status to disable notifications for a particular participant. The unique Samply ID is shown in the next column. The "Notification Token" column will show "OK" if the participant has allowed receiving notifications from the app, and "miss" if they have not. In the latter case, it is recommended to first allow notifications from the app Samply Research in the smartphone settings, and then leave and join the study again, so the token is correctly recorded. If a participant has left a study, the token will display "User left the study".
docs.data_participants_2: The "Entry Date" column shows the timestamp when the participant joined the study in the app. If you asked participants to enter a participant code and group while joining the study in the app, these will be displayed in the corresponding columns. Groups can also be added later in the "Groups" menu. Time preferences indicate whether participants entered a specific time when they would like to receive notifications in the app. However, the time preferences do not automatically affect notifications, so you have to adjust notifications manually. The timezone information is collected automatically from the participant's smartphone.
docs.data_participants_3: The link in the "Payout" column allows you to pay your participants using the payment system Stripe. To use it, participants should register their payable accounts with Stripe. The "Log" column displays links to the logs of the notifications sent to a particular participant. The "New Notification" column has links to the Notifications menu, where the participant's notifications can be scheduled. A participant can also be deleted by clicking the basket icon on the right-hand side of the table.
docs.data_results_1: By clicking on the tasks on the left, you can switch between results for different tasks. The table contains information about a participant and the type of data. The Samply ID is a unique number assigned to each user regardless of the participant code and name. You can either download data for a specific participant or download all results for that task.
docs.help_1: Please, join the Slack chat to ask questions and get help.
docs.introduction_1: Welcome to Samply, a platform for scheduling and sending notifications!
docs.introduction_2: We are glad to have you here. This documentation is written for researchers, so please first register or login as a researcher.
docs.introduction_3: The registration is simple and requires a university email address and a password.
docs.introduction_4: Samply is a web-site for researchers and a mobile application Samply Research for participants. After you create a notification schedule for your study on this website, the mobile application will notify your participants. The participants will follow the link on their mobile phones and participate in your online study.
docs.invitations_1: When users start an app, they will have to allow notifications from the app. The question about notifications should pop up automatically on the screen. Participants will also need to create a new account. The login information will be stored securely on the Samply server (which is the server of the University of Konstanz in Germany) and used only for authentication of users.
docs.invitations_2: After logging in, participants can either scan the QR code of your study (available on your study page) or find your study in the list of public studies. When participants open your study in the app, they will see the description and welcoming text. By clicking on the "Join the study" button, participants will allow to receive notifications from you. They can now close the application.
docs.invitations_3: You as a researcher will not have access to email addresses of participants. If you wish to have participants' email addresses, you are free to collect them together with other information via your online studies. Instead, Samply will share with you a unique id of each participant (in the form xxxxxx), which you can include as a query parameter in the link of your study. More information about that is in "Notifications".
docs.navigation_1: The documentation contains the information about the following main steps.
docs.navigation_1_1: Studies Create and manage your studies
docs.navigation_1_4: Data Review the history of sent notifications
docs.navigation_2: In the Search tasks field, you can enter the name of the task you want to search for.
docs.navigation_3: If you have more than one study, you can switch between them by using the ‚ÄúChoose a study‚Äù drop-down menu in the top navigation bar.
docs.navigation_4: Under ‚ÄúProfile‚Äù, you can edit your name, research institute and language. English, German, and Dutch are supported at the moment.
docs.notifications_1: Setting up the notifications plan requires defining the notification content (a title, message, and study URL) and deciding on the schedule. It is recommended to keep the title and message shorter than 30 characters each (including spaces) to make them compatible with all potential devices and screen sizes. The title can contain the study‚Äôs name (e.g., ‚ÄúStudy of life quality‚Äù) or the name of its current phase (‚ÄúLife quality study ‚Äì Day 1‚Äù). The message can include an instruction or what is expected from the participant, e.g., ‚ÄúPlease complete a 1-minute survey‚Äù. Another strategy is placing a survey question in the notification title or message.
docs.notifications_10_1: Choose when the link should expire
docs.notifications_10_2: You can choose the expiration time for links in notifications. For instance, if you want participants to respond within a one-hour time window, set the expiration time accordingly. The expiration time starts counting from the moment the notification is sent from the server. Unless a device is disconnected from the network (e.g. in airplane mode) or notifications are disabled, the delivery time is close to the sending time (within a range of one second). Once the link expires, participants can no longer open it from the notification tab or in the Samply app.
docs.notifications_11: When a notification has been added, it appears in the list of scheduled notifications, which can be controlled and cancelled at any time by clicking either the delete icon in the table or the ‚ÄúDelete all notifications‚Äù button.
docs.notifications_11_2: You can choose to send reminders that depend on the completion of a survey or task. For example, if a participant does not complete a survey within an hour, they will receive a reminder. By default, Samply will send reminders for each scheduled notification. You must redirect participants to a specific Samply web page or send a POST request to register a completion event to avoid sending reminders. Read here for instructions on how to create a completion event in your survey or task and connect it to Samply.
docs.notifications_2: The URL link may contain the participant‚Äôs ID: the placeholder ‚Äú%PARTICIPANT_CODE%‚Äù inside the weblink will be replaced with each user‚Äôs Samply ID (e.g., https://examplesurvey.com/?id=%PARTICIPANT_CODE%). This can be used to track survey participation if the URL query parameters are captured and saved in the survey. See the list of possible query placeholders below.
docs.notifications_3: If the user interface is followed step-by-step, the following choices have to be made in order to define the notifications schedule.
docs.notifications_3_2: You can select the specific time zone for notifications or adjust the time to the participant's time zone. Adjusting the time to the participant's time zone works for future and current participants with a specified time zone. Adjusting the time zone does not work for group notifications because group notifications are sent to all group members at the same time, so you must explicitly select the time zone for these notifications.
docs.notifications_4_2: Notifications can be sent either to all current and future participants or to a particular participant chosen from the menu under ‚ÄúCurrent participants‚Äù.
docs.notifications_5_2: A specific time point or time points can be selected by entering the hour and minute in the input field. Alternatively, a time window can be defined (e.g., from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.), during which a time point or time points can be randomly drawn. If numerous participants are selected, notification times will be randomized for each one.
docs.notifications_6_2: A specific date can be selected in the format of day, month, and year. Alternatively, if a notification need to be repeated, other options can be chosen.  Notifications can be sent every day or at a range of intervals (every 2nd, 3rd, 4th, etc. day). Alternatively, the day(s) of the week or day(s) of the month can be selected.
docs.notifications_7_2: Any specific month(s) can be chosen for notifications.
docs.notifications_8_2: Notifications can begin to be sent at specific time points defined by the time and date. Alternatively, a time point can be picked relative to the current moment or the moment of participant registration. In the latter case, the starting point will be different for each participant and will be determined by the time when a participant joins the study for the first time via the mobile app.
docs.notifications_9_2: The options here are similar to choosing when to start notifications. Different combinations of starting and stopping points can be created, e.g., notifications can start from the moment each participant registers but stop at one specific time point, which will be the same for everybody.
docs.project_demoResults_1: To give you an idea what the raw data looks like, you can view and download your own demo results here. The data is stored as a CSV-file with comma-separated values. The data during the experiment is saved in two formats: ‚Äúincremental‚Äù ‚Äì a new part of the data is logged each time there is a sufficient time window during the experiment (e.g., when a participant reads the instruction of a new experimental block), and ‚Äúfull‚Äù ‚Äì the data is transferred at the end of the experiment. So if a participant interrupts the task, only the incremental data up to the last snapshot will be saved. The results of the demo also show you how many records (rows) are stored in the data file.
docs.project_demo_1: You can already start each task individually, but this demo page will show you what the whole experiment will look like for participants. A participant will see the name of the test, its description and the status (completed or not yet completed). The tasks on the list appear in the order you specified in the study. Once a task is completed, a participant cannot repeat it.
docs.project_parameters_1: Using parameters enables customization of your study without having to change and upload the json file again. If a study has parameters, you can first see them listed next to the task. Second, you can change and save them one the ‚ÄúCustomized‚Äù tab. After saving, the task will run with your new parameters.
docs.project_parameters_2: To create parameters in your experiment script, place all your individual screens into one general sequence in the lab.js builder. For the main sequence screen, add parameters on the special page. Now, in your script in lab.js, you can use the name this.parameters.parameter_name to refer to parameters. When the json script is uploaded to Samply, the parameters are extracted and listed on the ‚ÄúParameters‚Äù tab.
docs.project_projects_1: Samply is organized by studies. As a researcher, after registering you will be prompted to create a new study. You can give it a name, provide a description, and write a welcome message for participants. This information will be displayed in the mobile application Samply Research. You can also upload an image file, which will be displayed next to your study in the mobile application. If you would like to share the study with someone you know on Samply, you can enter their email address. Otherwise, you can leave the field blank and share it later. Sharing a study allows you to collaborate on the project, share access to the notification schedule, and view the notification history.
docs.project_projects_2: After adding a study, you will see a card displaying the study's name, status, and two buttons (to edit and delete the study). The toggle switches at the bottom of the card are gray, indicating that your study is not currently active (not available for participants) and not public in the mobile application Samply Research. When you are ready to launch or test your study, toggle the left switch to activate it. Once your study is active, you will receive a unique web page link displayed on the study card. This link can be shared with participants to join your study in the mobile app. The second toggle switch can make your study public in the mobile app, visible to all app users in the list of public studies. To make your study public, you must submit an approval request, and your study must contain a consent form and be approved by an ethics committee.
docs.project_projects_3: If you have invited your colleagues to share access to the study, the number of your colleagues will be indicated on the study card.
docs.project_tasks_1: The next step after creating a new study is to add tasks. You can select tasks from the list of available tasks and add them to the list on the right by clicking on the green plus button. The order on the list corresponds to the order in which your participants will see the tasks. This allows a study to include more than one task.
docs.queryBatchInfo: The notification number for each participant. The number begins with 1 and increases by 1 with each notification sent.
docs.queryCodeInfo: The participant code entered by a participant when joining your study
docs.queryGroupIDInfo: The group code entered by a participant when joining your study
docs.queryMessageInfo: Each notification has a unique ID
docs.querySamplyIDInfo: The ID of participant on the platform Samply
docs.queryTimeInfo: When the message is sent from the server (the number of milliseconds elapsed since January 1, 1970)

history.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete all the records?
history.downloadInfo: When you download the history of notifications, the time of the events is saved as a timestamp. In JavaScript, a timestamp is the number of milliseconds that have passed since January 1, 1970.
history.receivedInOpenApp: Received when the app was open

index.test_drive: Are you a researcher and want to use Samply in your studies? Here is an overview of how Samply works, our publication in Behavior Research Methods, and step-by-step tutorial in English or German.
index.welcome_text: Samply supports experience sampling, ambulatory assessment and diary studies. We want to make sending notifications to participants an easy and comfortable task for researchers. The main idea is that you as a researcher are free to use any tool to create an online survey or an experiment.  Samply sends mobile notifications through the Samply mobile application, so when participants of your study click on the notification, they open your online study in a mobile web-browser.

invitations.activate_study_2: by turning on the toggle switch on the study card here.
invitations.custom_link: Custom link to your study in the mobile app
invitations.custom_link_1: You can also pass additional variables via the link using the query. For example, if you want to create individual links, you can modify the link in the following way. The value of the variable <var>code</var>, which you provide inside the link (in this case, it is <kbd>123</kbd>), will be recorded and shown in your participants data.
invitations.direct_link: Direct link to your study in the mobile app
invitations.direct_link_1: To use this link, participants should already have the ‚ÄúSamply Research‚Äù app installed on their mobile phone. Furthermore, they should open this link in their mobile phone. When participants open the app for the first time, they must allow notifications from the app. The question about the notifications should appear automatically on the screen. Participants will also need to create a new account. The login information is stored securely on the Samply server (which is the server of the University of Konstanz in Germany) and is only used to authenticate users.
invitations.direct_link_2: After creating an account, participants are automatically redirected to the page of your study within the application. The study description is displayed on the study page. When participants click on the "Join the study" button, they see the text that you entered for the consent form. When participants tap the "Yes, I agree" button, they join your study and allow you to send them notifications. Now, the application can be closed.
invitations.direct_link_3: Note that the direct link will work even if your study is not publicly available in the list of studies.
invitations.finding_study: If your study is public, participants can find it in the list of public studies within the app. To apply for approval of your study for the public list, please submit a request here. After logging in, participants must switch to the "Studies" tab within the app. There they can use the search field to find your study. In the list of studies the name, the author and the creation date of the study are displayed. Please give your participants the exact name of your study so that they can find it in the app. When the participants tap on your study in the list of studies, they will be taken to the study page.
invitations.message_create_project: To invite new participants to your study, activate or create a study here.
invitations.mobile_invite_1: There are three ways to invite participants to your study. In all cases, participants must first install the mobile application Samply Research on their smartphone. For Android users, the application is available in Google Play. For Apple users, the application is in App Store. You can provide participants with these links to the Google Play or App Store or ask them to search for the Samply Research app in the respective stores.
invitations.mobile_invite_2: After the application is installed, either provide a participant with 1) a web page link, 2) a direct link to your study in the mobile app or 3) instructions how to find your study in the list of studies in the mobile app (if your study is public).
invitations.way_0_header: Way 1. The web page of your study
invitations.way_1_header: Way 2. The direct link to your study in the mobile app
invitations.way_2_header: Way 3. Ask participants to find your study in the mobile app
invitations.web_link: The web page of your study
invitations.web_link_1: The web page of your study contains the description of your study, the information about the authors and the instructions how participants can take part in the study. A unique QR code is used to find a study in the mobile app. Your study does not have to be public for the QR code to work.

layout.agree_to_conditions: I agree to the Samply Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
layout.already_have_code: If you already know your participant code, login
layout.check_green_button: If it is not present, try reloading the page. Otherwise, go to the menu and choose the option "Add website to Home Screen".
layout.click_to_unsuscribe: Click to unsubscribe from notifications from the study.
layout.create_participant_account: To create a participant account, please use the mobile app Samply Research in Google Play or App Store.
layout.example_web_link: If you need to record the participant Samply ID in your task or survey, use the placeholder %SAMPLY_ID% inside the URL. If you want to capture the participant code entered when joining your study, use the placeholder %PARTICIPANT_CODE%. Note that if a participant did not enter a code, %PARTICIPANT_CODE% will be replaced by the Samply ID. Then, inside of your online study you can extract the participant code or the Samply ID from the url address. Read more about query strings and see all available placeholders here. The combination of query parameters would look like this, e.g. https://survey.com/?id=%SAMPLY_ID%&code=%PARTICIPANT_CODE%&messageid=%MESSAGE_ID%.
layout.fill_in_information: Fill in the information for your notification
layout.flash_cannot_delete: The study could not be deleted. Check whether you typed the name of the study correctly.

layout.install_instruction: 1. Install the application on your phone by clicking on the green "Install App" button in the menu above. We recommend using Google Chrome as your browser. If you use a different browser, please switch to Google Chrome before installing the app.
layout.install_instructions_2: After the installation of the application, please click the button "Enter" below to join the study.
layout.install_title: Before you enter the study, pless install the application on your mobile phone.
layout.instructions_1: Use your mobile phone to navigate to this website.
layout.instructions_1_note: Important! Apple does not support the web push notifications yet.
layout.instructions_2: Install the application on your phone by clicking on the button "Install App" in the menu above.
layout.instructions_2_note: If the button is not present, try reloading the page. Otherwise, go to the menu and choose the option "Add website to Home Screen".
layout.instructions_3: After the installation of the application, you can close the browser and open the application.
layout.instructions_4: Inside the application, proceed to the Studies page, and follow the instructions there to subscribe for a particular study.
layout.intro: Scientists discover the nature of the human being  - You can help with this task! Instead of coming to a research laboratory, you can take part anywhere with your mobile phone. This is made possible by the ‚ÄûExperience sampling method‚Äú. You will receive notifications throughout the day with questions to answer.
layout.intro_2: The content of the survey and the notification schedule vary from study to study. Read the study description for details.
layout.intro_3: You are a researcher and you want to create a study? Please visit the page for researchers.
layout.lab_js_loading_1: The experiment is loading and should start in a few seconds.
layout.message_history_create_project: Create or activate a study to see the history of notifications.
layout.message_signup: If it is your first time here, please sign up as a participant or as a researcher.
layout.not_supported: Sorry, notifications on your device are not possible if you want to participate in a study. This may be because you are using an Apple device. In this case please use Android or another device.
layout.sign_message: Please sign up as a researcher if you want to conduct a study.
layout.signup_or_login: Please sign up or log in
layout.subscribe_notifications: Please press the button "Subsribe" to subscribe to notifications from this study.
layout.subscriptionNeededMessage: Please subscribe to a plan in order to add more studies.
layout.test_card_privacy_message: The task is available only to you and your participants
layout.title: Welcome to Samply
layout.title_information: Notifications with the same title will replace each other to avoid the users' screen being filled with a huge number of similar notifications.
layout.upgradeNeededMessage: Please upgrade your plan in order to add unlimited amount of studies.
layout.use_uni_email: Please use your university email address.
layout.were_invited: If you were invited to participate in a study with a web-link, follow the link and read the instructions provided on the study page.
layout.worksParticipants_1: Joining Samply as a participant gives you access to various studies created by researchers. There are many reasons why you might be interested in online studies: financial reward, interest in the topic or simply curiosity.
layout.worksParticipants_2: The way in which participants are rewarded depends on a particular study. Researchers often promote their studies and offer monetary rewards such as payments or participation in lotteries. If you are a student at a university, you can earn credit points from a researcher at your university. You may also be interested in receiving feedback and learning more about yourself.
layout.worksParticipants_3_1: Once registered, you do not need to register for each individual study.
layout.worksParticipants_3_2: Different types of authorization: participation code, email address and password, Facebook, Google and Github.
layout.worksParticipants_4_1: According to the law on personal data, you can see what kind of data is available to a researcher.
layout.worksParticipants_4_2: You can also ask the researcher to delete your data if you wish.

newproject.actionsDescription: You can specify up to four action buttons. Enter the identifier and the title of the button for each action button you want to use. The identifier is passed to your notification URL as the query parameter "action". If a participant taps on the notification (instead of the action buttons), there is no "action" query parameter in the URL. The title of the button is displayed to the user.
newproject.active_description: The program is open for participation
newproject.approvalInfo_1: Public studies are displayed in the list of studies in the mobile application Samply Research for participants. Your study does not have to be public to run a study. You can use QR codes (see way 1) to invite participants to your study. This way, you stay in control of who participates in your study.
newproject.approvalInfo_2: If you want to make your study public and visible to every user of the mobile app, please apply send us an approval request by pressing the button below. Note that only studies with complete instructions, consent forms, information about researchers, and a confirmed researcher email address are permitted. If you want to test your study, please use the option with the direct invitation via QR code (way 1) instead.
newproject.approvedInfo_1: Your study is now public, which means that it is displayed in the public list of studies in the Samply Research mobile application.
newproject.approvedInfo_2: If you want to remove the study from the public list, press the button below. Note that this action cannot be undone. If you want to to make your study public again later, you would need to reapply for approval.
newproject.askGroup: Ask participants to enter a group code in the mobile application when joining your study
newproject.askNotifications: Ask users to allow notifications (we are currently testing notifications, participants should use Chrome on a desktop computer).
newproject.askUsername: Ask participants to enter an individual participant code in the mobile application when joining your study
newproject.codeMessage: Please write the instructions for the participant on what to enter as an individual participant code.
newproject.completionMessage: (If you are redirect participants to the Samply page to register a completion event) The text that is displayed to participants after they complete a survey or task.
newproject.confirmMessage_1: Please type the name of the study
newproject.confirmMessage_2: to confirm that you want to delete the study.
newproject.confirmMessage_3: All results of this study will be deleted.
newproject.description: Description (please tell what is your study is about, how long and how often you plan to send notifications)
newproject.development_description: The program is hidden from participants
newproject.enableActionsToggle: Enable action buttons (this allows you to set quick actions that participants can perform with interactive notifications; participants will need to rejoin your study if you have changed the action buttons)
newproject.enableGeofencingToggle: Enable Geofencing (geofencing allows you to notify and send surveys to your participants when they enter or leave specific areas, e.g. home, supermarket, workplace)
newproject.feelingLucky: I'm feeling lucky; I'll choose a random picture.
newproject.geoExplained: Geofencing requires a constant tracking of geolocation. This tracking happens on the participant device, so neither Samply nor you will have the information about the absolute geolocation of participants. However, it is important that participants understand how you will use the information, such as when they enter or leave geofenced areas. Please provide the information about the geofencing to the participant. This instruction will be shown when the participant has joined your study.
newproject.geoNotifyHide: Invisible mode (do not show notifications but record the events)
newproject.geoPlaceholderEnterLink: Enter the URL link to your online task or survey
newproject.geoPlaceholderExitZone: The size of the active exit zone (in meters)
newproject.geoPlaceholderMinTimeWindow: The minimum time window between notifications (in minutes)
newproject.geoResearcherDefinedExplained: Enter the information about locations that should apply to all participants. Start adding new locations, and they will be shown on the map after you click "Save". Then you can edit the locations by dragging markers on the map.
newproject.geoTriggerHide: Hide notifications but record the events
newproject.geoUserDefinedLinkPlaceholder: Enter the link to your online survey (the link will be sent with the notification)
newproject.geoUserDefinedTitleExplained: If you ask participants to provide their own locations, specify the URL link of the survey/task and the radius (in meters) for a location. Leave the URL field blank if you do not use an external online task/survey. In this case, participants will be only notified when they enter or exit the geofenced area.
newproject.groupMessage: Please write the instructions for the participant on what to enter as a group code.
newproject.imageURL: Image to display next to your study on the website and in the mobile application
newproject.invite_members: Enter your colleagues' email addresses to give them access to the study. They should be registered on Samply to get the access.
newproject.messageAfterJoin: The text that will be displayed to participants after they have joined the study.
newproject.name: Name
newproject.permanentLink: The permanent link for your study that can be used for event-contingent designs where participants are asked to initiate a report after a specific event occurs. The link is displayed to participants in the mobile app after they join your study. You can include the participant's Samply ID, participant code (entered when they joined the study), group ID, and timestamp in the link. To do this, use the placeholders %SAMPLY_ID%, %PARTICIPANT_CODE%, %GROUP_ID%, and %TIMESTAMP% within the URL as part of the query strings, for example https://survey.com/?id=%SAMPLY_ID%&code=%PARTICIPANT_CODE%&group=%GROUP_ID%&time=%TIMESTAMP%.
newproject.removeFromPublicBtn: Remove the study from the public list in the mobile application
newproject.requestedInfo_1: Your request for approval has been submitted. If you don't hear from us for a while, don't hesitate to contact us using Slack forum, a contact form, or an email.
newproject.showCompletionCode: Display the unique completion code at the end of all tasks
newproject.webhooksDescription: Webhooks allow you to receive POST requests to your endpoint (URL) when certain events occur. Please select the events below and enter the URL of your endpoint.
newproject.webhooksEndpoint: Your endpoint (URL) to receive post requests with updates
newproject.welcomeMessage: The text for the consent form in the mobile application. This is displayed when the participants click on "Join the study". You can provide the consent form here.
newproject.welcomeMessage (2): The text for the consent form in the mobile application. This is displayed when the participants click on "Join the study". You can provide the consent form here.

notifications.message_create_project: To set up notifications, activate or create a study here.
notifications.scheduledLink: You can find your scheduled notifications here
notifications.step_0_participant_timezone: Adjust the time to the participant's time zone (this should work for future and current participants with a specified time zone).
notifications.step_2_every_10_minute: at every 10th minute past each hour (e.g., at 12:00, 12:10, 12:20, ...)
notifications.step_2_every_15_minute: at every 15th minute past each hour (e.g., at 12:00, 12:15, 12:30, ...)
notifications.step_2_every_2_minute: at every 2nd minute past each hour (e.g., at 12:00, 12:02, 12:04, ...)
notifications.step_2_every_30_minute: at every 30th minute past each hour (e.g., at 12:00, 12:30, 13:00, ...)
notifications.step_2_every_5_minute: at every 5th minute past each hour (e.g., at 12:00, 12:05, 12:10, ...)
notifications.step_2_random: How many time points should be randomly selected from this time window?
notifications.step_2_windows: Time window (the exact time point(s) will be chosen randomly)
notifications.step_3_monthday: Repeat on specific day(s) of month (choose one or many)
notifications.step_3_weekday: Repeat on specific day(s) of week (choose one or many)
notifications.step_4_specific: Repeat in specific month(s) (choose one or many)
notifications.step_5_next: Start sending notification for each participant on the day
notifications.step_5_participant: Start sending notification for each participant after
notifications.step_5_registration: the moment of the participant registration
notifications.step_6_next: Stop sending notification for each participant at the end of the day
notifications.step_6_participant: Stop sending notification for each participant after
notifications.step_7_header: 8. Choose when the link should expire
notifications.step_7_minutes: minutes after the notification is sent
notifications.step_8_reminder_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è This is still a beta version. You can send reminders that depend on the completion of a survey or task. For example, if a participant does not complete a survey within an hour, they will receive a reminder. By default, Samply will send reminders for each scheduled notification. You must redirect participants to a specific Samply web page or send a POST request to register a completion event to avoid sending reminders. Read here for instructions on how to create a completion event in your survey or task and connect it to Samply.
notifications.step_day_explained: * Day 1 is the same day, day 2 is the next day, etc.
notifications.table_adjusting_timezone: Adjusting to the participant's time zone
notifications.table_all_groups: Applies to all groups at the moment of notification creation
notifications.table_all_participants: Applies to all participants at the moment of notification creation
notifications.table_repeat_window: Repeat in the time window from
notifications.table_stop_at_the_end_of: Stop at the end of the
notifications.title: Title

passport.flash_confirm_email: We have sent an email with a confirmation link to your email address. In order to complete the sign-up process, please click the confirmation link.
passport.registered_user: You are registered as a new user!

payout.paymentInfo: Payments and invoicing are managed by our partner Stripe. A 5% processing fee is deducted from the payment.
payout.paymentInfoNotRegistered: To receive payments, the participant should register a payable account. To do that, the participant should log in to the website and navigate to the profile page.

researcher.advantage_1: More and more studies in social sciences are being implemented online. However, there are barriers to the use of the Internet. First, technical difficulties in conducting an online-experiment. Even if a simple questionnaire is not a problem, an experimental paradigm is already a burden for researchers who want to collect data online.
researcher.advantage_2: Second, although the replicability crisis has triggered a number of important innovations such as study pre-registration, open access to data and analysis methods, the methods of data collection are often concealed under general specifications in the method section. Especially in online experiments, where the software is directly accessible to a participant, the code and parameters of the user-computer interaction are rarely documented and opened for other researchers.
researcher.advantage_3: Thirdly, data security is difficult for a researcher who is just beginning to program his or her own study. Not every available service supports secure data transmission from a participant to the server. Also, the personal information (e.g., email address) is often stored together with the results of the experiment.
researcher.advantage_4: To overcome these limitations, Samply offers a researcher a way to conduct an online-study without technical difficulties. It frees time to focus on more important methodological and data analysis work. The experiments are automatically documented and stored so that cooperation with colleagues and meta-analyses of previous studies are possible. The HTTPS protocol ensures that participants' data is encrypted during transmission. User access to experiments can be protected by various authentication strategies such as participant codes, e-mails, passwords or accounts on social networks.
researcher.feature_1: You do not need to set up your own server to run a study.
researcher.feature_2: Samply can host any type of scripts created in lab.js.
researcher.feature_3: Your study can enroll more participants from the community of Samply users.
researcher.feature_4: You can share your experiments with colleagues.
researcher.feature_5: HTTPS data transfer protocol ensures that data is encrypted during transmission.
researcher.feature_6: The user authentication system allows you to create complex studies in which people take part in experiments separated in time.
researcher.feature_7: Samply provides a system of data management including saving of data during an experiment.
researcher.step_1: Use existing templates or create your own study with lab.js experiment builder
researcher.step_2: Import the experiment file into Samply
researcher.step_3: Send the invitation link to participants and monitor their progress in real time
researcher.step_4: Please check the documentation for more information or join our Slack chat to ask questions and get help.

scheduled.confirmDeletion: Delete scheduled notification? This action cannot be undone.
scheduled.job_description_1: There are different types of jobs:
scheduled.job_description_2: One-time notification is sent once to specified user (see User ID) or groups (see group ID)
scheduled.job_description_3: Regular notification is sent repeatedly at the specified intervals (see Interval)
scheduled.job_description_4: Start and end managers take care of starting and stopping regular notifications
scheduled.job_description_5: Randomizer takes care of scheduling a one-time notification at a random time. Randomizer usually runs at the beginning of a time window.
scheduled.job_description_6: Start and end randomizer managers take care of starting and stopping randomizers
scheduled.job_description_7: Some jobs, such as one-time notifications, are automatically deleted after they are done. Other jobs are deleted by end managers. See the history page for the overview of sent notifications.
scheduled.job_description_8: You can manually edit or delete a scheduled job. Note that other jobs and the original record of scheduled notifications (displayed above) will not be affected.

studies.alreadyAppHeader: Already have installed the mobile application Samply Research?
studies.already_instruction: Use the app to scan the QR code below to join the study, or just click the button below if you are already on a smartphone.
studies.arleadyParticipant: You are already registered in this study. Check your mobile app Samply Research for more information.
studies.completionMessage: Thank you for completing the survey! You may close this page.
studies.firstTimeStep_1: 1. You should first install the mobile application Samply Research on your smartphone. For Android users, the application is available in Google Play. For Apple users, the application is in App Store.
studies.firstTimeStep_2: 2. When you open the app for the first time, you will need to create a participant account. The login information is stored securely on the Samply server (which is the server of the University of Konstanz in Germany) and is only used to authenticate users. The login information (your email and password) is not available to researchers.
studies.firstTimeStep_3: 3. Inside the app, click the button "Find a study", then "Scan QR code" and scan the following QR code. Alternatively, use the Camera app of your smartphone to scan the QR code. After that, follow the instructions of the study.
studies.goToStudy: Open the study in the app
studies.how_to_participate: How to participate in the study
studies.no_tests_in_study: There are no publicly available tasks in this study.
studies.scanQRcode: Scan this QR code to join the study in the mobile app

testing.direct_link_1: To use this link, you should already have the ‚ÄúSamply Research‚Äù app installed on your mobile phone. Furthermore, you should open this link in your mobile phone. When you open the app for the first time, you must allow notifications from the app. The question about the notifications should appear automatically on the screen. Then, you will need to create a new account. The login information is stored securely on the Samply server (which is the server of the University of Konstanz in Germany) and is only used to authenticate users.
testing.direct_link_2: After creating an account, you should be automatically redirected to the page of the study within the application. The study description is displayed on the study page. When you click on the "Join the study" button, you will see the text of the consent form. When you tap the "Yes, I agree" button, you will join the study and allow the study to send you notifications. Now, the application can be closed.
testing.direct_link_3: Note that the direct link will work even if the study is not publicly available in the list of studies.
testing.finding_study: If for some reason you cannot use the direct link, you can find the study in the list of public studies within the app. After logging in, you must switch to the "Studies" tab within the app. There you can use the search field to find the study. You can use the exact name of the study to search for it. In the list of studies, the name, the author and the creation date of the study are displayed. When you tap on the study in the list of studies, you will be taken to the study page.
testing.message_create_project: Create or activate a study to see the demo.
testing.message_next: Click here to start the next task
testing.mobile_invite_1: There are two ways for you join the study. In both cases, you must first install the mobile application Samply Research on your mobile phone. For Android users, the application is available in Google Play. For Apple users, the application is in App Store.
testing.mobile_invite_2: After the application is installed, either use the direct link to the study or find the study in the list of studies inside the application.
testing.name: Name
testing.sign_out: To unsubscribe from the study, please use the mobile application Samply Research. Go to the study page within the application and click on the button "Leave the study".
testing.title: Demo Program
testing.way_1_header: Way 1. The direct link to the study
testing.way_2_header: Way 2. Find the study in the app
testing.your_code: This code confirms the completion of your tasks:
